words.def: a long narrow excavation in the earth
a dismissive term for a girl who is immature or who lacks respect
a contagious skin infection caused by the itch mite
the circulating life energy that in Chinese philosophy is thought to be inherent in all things
prevent from being seen or discovered
(baseball) a successful stroke in an athletic contest (especially in baseball)
a local and habitual twitching especially in the face
the shorter of the two telegraphic signals used in Morse code
a state in the Rocky Mountains
the branch of engineering that deals with the use of computers and telecommunications to retrieve and store and transmit information
a light strong grey lustrous corrosion-resistant metallic element used in strong lightweight alloys (as for airplane parts)
